newsitem.title: USA: Harvard junk down, firm still negotiating.
newsitem.headline: Harvard junk down, firm still negotiating.

text.p: Prices of Harvard Industries Inc junk bonds tumbled 10 points following rumors, later denied, that the firm's efforts to sell its Harman Automotive unit fell through, market sources said.
"We are still trying to put together a deal that the (buyer) can get financing for," said Richard Dawson, Harvard's senior vice president for law and administration.
Dawson said Harvard is still working with Salomon Brothers to complete the sale of its unit for $18 million to an undisclosed buyer.
